alert.note: Alert for Lonoke (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 11 at 10:35PM CDT until April 11 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN PRAIRIE...NORTH CENTRAL LONOKE AND SOUTHERN WHITE COUNTIES... At 1035 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over McRae, or 8 miles south of Searcy, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Searcy... Des Arc... Beebe... Bald Knob... Judsonia... Kensett... Higginson... West Point... Crosby... Hurricane Lake WMA... Pryor... McRae... Garner... Griffithville... Antioch in White County... Vinity Corner... Hayley... Worden... Jasmine... Floyd... This includes US Highway 67 between mile markers 28 and 56. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for central and eastern Arkansas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
